headline.main: Beijing Journal; China Is Fighting for Its Soul: Its Looted Antiques

docs.snippet: It was not drugs the peasant was selling under the cover of darkness, but something just as restricted, and he was very careful as he displayed his wares on a quiet street before dawn.    "Ming Dynasty," the peasant, a thin man in his 40's, nervous
docs.lead_paragraph: It was not drugs the peasant was selling under the cover of darkness, but something just as restricted, and he was very careful as he displayed his wares on a quiet street before dawn. "Ming Dynasty," the peasant, a thin man in his 40's, nervously told a dealer, who was crouched down, scrutinizing the blue-and-white porcelain vases. If they really did date from the Ming Dynasty, which collapsed in 1644, then they were probably dug from a tomb and are barred from leaving the country.
